The Perl code logged in again as the 'cassandane' user and did some work, then finished (cleanly or not, we can't tell from here)
Jul 25 05:07:07 hudson-01 cassandane: =====> Instance[825] stop Jul 25 05:07:07 hudson-01 cassandane: =====> Instance[803] _stop_pid: sending signal 3 to 3640
In tear_down() now, shutting down the instance. We start by sending a graceful shutdown signal to master
Jul 25 05:07:07 hudson-01 0904467/master[3640]: attempting clean shutdown on signal
which master notices just fine
Jul 25 05:07:07 hudson-01 0904467/master[3640]: process 3648 exited, status 75
and master apparently re-send the graceful shutdown signal to the imapd whose pid is 3648, which exits as expected.
However, judging by the logs above, master should have two imapd children, pids 3648 and 3649. It looks like 3649 is AWOL, and master is just waiting for it to die.
Jul 25 05:07:37 hudson-01 cassandane: =====> Instance[810] _stop_pid: failed to shut down pid 3640 with signal 3 Jul 25 05:07:37 hudson-01 cassandane: =====> Instance[803] _stop_pid: sending signal 4 to 3640 Jul 25 05:07:37 hudson-01 cassandane: =====> Util::Wait[75] Waited 0.010895 sec for unknown condition
after 30 seconds the Perl code gets impatient and sends a SIGILL to finish master off, which left us a core file. It also caused the test failure message.
When I logged in, there was no pid 3649 running. Nor was there a core from it.
The master core is
(gdb) bt #0 0x00000036658cd2ee in pselect () from /lib64/libc.so.6 #1 0x00000000004025a2 in myselect (nfds=12, rfds=0x7fff768aabb0, wfds=0x0, efds=0x0, tout=0x0) at master/master.c:204 #2 0x000000000040c327 in main (argc=12, argv=0x7fff768aadd8) at master/master.c:2227
(gdb) print ctable $1 = {0x0 <repeats 3648 times>, 0x131290a0, 0x131290d0, 0x0 <repeats 6350 times>}
(gdb) p *(struct centry *)0x131290a0 $2 = {pid = 3648, service_state = SERVICE_STATE_DEAD, janitor_deadline = 1343207229, si = 1, next = 0x0}
(gdb) p *(struct centry *)0x131290d0 $3 = {pid = 3649, service_state = SERVICE_STATE_READY, janitor_deadline = 0, si = 0, next = 0x0}
So yes, master thinks pid 3648 is dead and 3649 is still running.
What other traces of pid 3649 are there? We have a telemetry log
---------- cassandane Wed Jul 25 05:07:07 2012
>1343207227>1 OK [CAPABILITY IMAP4rev1 LITERAL+ ID ENABLE ACL RIGHTS=kxten QUOTA MAILBOX-REFERRALS NAMESPACE UIDPLUS NO_ATOMIC_RENAME UNSELECT CHILDREN MULTIAPPEND BINARY CATENATE CONDSTORE ESEARCH SORT SORT=MODSEQ SORT=DISPLAY SORT=UID THREAD=ORDEREDSUBJECT THREAD=REFERENCES ANNOTATEMORE ANNOTATE-EXPERIMENT-1 METADATA LIST-EXTENDED LIST-STATUS WITHIN QRESYNC SCAN XLIST XMOVE MOVE SPECIAL-USE CREATE-SPECIAL-USE URLAUTH URLAUTH=BINARY LOGINDISABLED COMPRESS=DEFLATE X-QUOTA=STORAGE X-QUOTA=MESSAGE X-QUOTA=X-ANNOTATION-STORAGE IDLE] User logged in SESSIONID=<0904467-3649-1343207227-1> <1343207227<2 create Drafts >1343207227>2 OK Completed <1343207227<3 create 2001/05/wk18 >1343207227>3 OK Completed <1343207227<4 create 2001/05/wk19 >1343207227>4 OK Completed <1343207227<5 create 2001/05/wk20 >1343207227>5 OK Completed <1343207227<6 subscribe 2001/05/wk20 >1343207227>6 OK Completed <1343207227<7 list "" 2001 >1343207227>* LIST (\Noselect \HasChildren) "/" 2001 7 OK Completed (0.000 secs 3 calls) <1343207227<8 logout >1343207227>* BYE LOGOUT received 8 OK Completed
Given that the test code
sub test_list_2011 { my ($self) = @_;
my $imaptalk = $self->{store}->get_client();
my $alldata = $imaptalk->list("", "2001"); $self->assert_deep_equals($alldata, [ [ [ '\\Noselect', '\\HasChildren' ], '/', '2001' ] ], "LIST data mismatch: " . Dumper($alldata)); }
That telemetry looks like the entire test ran successfully to completion, and the client was logged out naturally by the test tear_down.
How long did pid 3649 survive? After the cassandane tests run, the jenkins-build.sh script kills any remaining processes running as the 'cyrus' user, but first prints out a list of them.
Test failures and errors summary ================================
[…]
184 run, 0 failures, 4 errors + ps -u cyrus PID TTY TIME CMD + sudo -n /usr/bin/killall -u cyrus
So pid 3649 did not survive until the end of the cassandane run.
This leaves two scenarios as obvious candidates.
1. Pid 3649 exited naturally and early, and master never noticed. This would imply a race condition or logic problem in master's child reaping code.
2. Pid 3649 was sent a signal, and did not take notice of it within the 30 second timeout, and then died soon after either from the signal or from other causes.
So, still a little bit of a mystery. But given that we haven't seen regular test failures like this for this test or any other, leads me to suspect it's a very obscure race condition. Yay.
